root.name: Simon
root.description: Re-invented and re-implemented many times since its introduction in 1978, Simon is a simple memory game consisting of four colored buttons, each producing a tone when pressed. To avoid cacophony, these tones form a perfect fourth, fifth, and octave with the tonic. On each turn, the computer generates and plays a random sequence of tones for the player to repeat using the buttons. With each successful repetition the sequence gets longer - ad infinitum, ad nauseum.
